metadata.dc:author: León-Álvarez, Damián Alfredo
Quintero-Medrano, Samantha Melissa
Angulo-Bueno, Gladys Fabiola
Ávila-Vergara, Marco Antonio
Vadillo-Ortega, Felipe
López-Villegas, Miriam Nayeli
metadata.dc:description: Agenesia of the Müllerian ducts is a low-frequency congenital disease but with devastating effects on women's reproductive health. In this paper we present two cases of women affected by Mayer-Rokitansky-Küster-Hauser syndrome (MRKH). First case was a 17-year-old woman with aplasia of the upper vagina and absence of uterus. No other defects were found and was classified as type 1-MRKH. Second case was 18-year-old woman with absence of uterus, escoliosis and polycystic ovary syndrome, classified as type II-MRKH. Patients were seen at the Hospital with primary amenorrhea and fully developed secondary sexual characteristics. A clinical follow-up protocol, including the use of high-resolution image studies was used for diagnosis. Diagnostic procedures and current medical approaches to the treatment of MRKH are discussed, including psychological advisory, surgical procedures and new tissue-engineering techniques.
metadata.dc:title: Síndrome de Mayer-Rokitansky-Küster-Hauser. Reporte de dos casos.
[Mayer-Rokitansky-Küster-Hauser syndrome: two cases report].
